entries.title: Q4 spotlight: starter kit & roadmap sync
entries.summary: The community onboarding kit ships alongside app build 1.8.0 so deck creators and players see the same milestones.
siteHighlights: Deck gallery pages now revalidate every five minutes with ISR, letting newly approved uploads appear without a rebuild.
Moderator dashboard adds status filters, review notes, and side-by-side deck diffs to speed publishing decisions.
appHighlights: Added cooperative and competitive match presets with shared timer tuning for faster lobby setup.
Deck browser inside the app now supports category, tag, and difficulty filters that mirror the website gallery.

entries.title: Beta refresh: moderation & match tuning
entries.summary: Infrastructure groundwork that paved the way for automated moderation and richer match rules.
siteHighlights: Upload pipeline now enforces rate limiting plus optional hCaptcha so community drops stay healthy.
Documented the storage migration helper that moves legacy deck blobs into object storage via scripts/starter-kit.
appHighlights: Introduced NSFW and language quick filters in the in-app deck picker.
Launched a shared-score cooperative mode so mixed skill groups can chase milestones together.

tutorials.intro: Catch up on the walkthroughs that originally aired during our contributor livestreams.

items.title: Deck upload livestream recap
items.summary: From exporting JSON with the helper script to passing moderation with a complete submission package.
steps: Clone the repository, run `node scripts/starter-kit/generate.mjs` to grab the latest template, and fill in your deck metadata.
Visit `/decks/upload`, drop in the JSON, add an optional cover URL, and review the live preview for schema issues.
Submit the deck, note the moderation status banner, and confirm the automated email or Discord notification fires.

items.title: In-app import tutorial
items.summary: Demonstrates importing the starter kit deck in Alioss 1.8.0 and testing match presets.
steps: Copy the hosted JSON URL from the starter kit, open Alioss, and tap the import button on the deck tab.
Paste the link, toggle the new language and difficulty filters to confirm metadata shipped correctly, then import.
Start a cooperative match preset, verify the timer and scoring goals, and run a sample round to ensure cards cycle.
